subject: more NFL
event:
Life is meaningless and has no purpose.

And my teams both suck.

This could be a very long season.

comments.article: oh that sucks, I know the feeling, Northern Ireland football team went from being top of the group to having no chance after losing two games straight and scoring own goals in both

Do not despair of the Jets. The game would have been tied if Justin McCairens had some sticky goop on his hands!

Kellen Clemens is going to be something special!

Clemens look fantastic in the second half.  His receiving corp just let him down.  If he can keep at that level and get some experience under his belt he's definitely going to have a starting QB job in his future.

comments.upictitle: Popular series of fiction, fancy, and fact.: Benevolent sense of life
comments.article:
I hear finishing books is an excellent way to cheer one's self up.

(Well, one's fans up, anyway.)
2nd

Being as I'm an NY Giants fan, I share your pain. But this is why you should enter fantasy football and/or survivor pools. It really gets you invested even when your team are doing terribly.

And believe it or not, I'm glad the Giants lost. I want them to do terrible this year, so Coughlin gets fired. I don't think we'll ever win anything with him at the helm. What I'd really like to see is the Carolina Panthers having an awful season also, so maybe John Fox gets fired and he gets hired as the new head coach for the Giants. It was a shame when we lost him the first time around. He's a much better coach than Fassel ever was.
I'm like you, but with Syracuse football.  I would do so many things to get Greg Robinson fired...

i'm a Steeler Fan that Lives in Indianapolis.

yeah, it will be a long one.
I just feel bad because you live in Indianapolis. of course I'm slightly biased because my six months in Carmel, IN were some of the most stressful of my life.

comments.upictitle: Random Writings: Enter At Own Risk
comments.article:
I live in New England, and the Jets game was our second AFC game. I thought Clemens played a good game, and was a couple of dropped passes away from pulling that game out. The Jets may yet turn it around, don't give up on them yet.

The G-men, though.... :: shakes head sadly :: That was UGLY. I share your pain.

You think you have it bad? Try being a Vikings' fan. Winter is coming, but we play in a sucky dome, and haven't been to the Super Bowl since we actually played in winter. So we feel your pain.

By the way, what house would Cheatin' Bill belong to? Something that serves House Lannister, I am sure. Or maybe House Bolton or Frey?
comments.subject: Life has no purpose

comments.article:
Hmmm, I'd say the Vale. Littlefinger and his trickery!

I'm also sadly a Vikings fan. I've learned to just be pessimistic always. After losing in '98 and losing the G-men 41-0 in the NFC Championship game, I've lost all hope.
comments.subject: Re: Life has no purpose

comments.article:
I too am a Giants fan and I like the Jets, but not a true fan.

However, I had every expectation that the Gints would stink. After all, we have an organization that's married to the belief that we have Payton instead of Eli. There were no great improvements on the lines and the battle is won in the trenches. The running game took a hit simply because Coughlin doesn't get that you treat you best players and proven veterans differently than you do rookies and the rest of the team.

5 games... If they win more I'll be doing cartwheels. Go Blue!

As for the Jets. I am a bit surprised. I don't follow them closely, but I'm guessing they will improve and likely be in the running to make the playoffs.

So, the winter may be cold, but maybe the autumn will be hot. Let's go Mets!
Jerricho looked pretty darned good. Just couldn't get into the endzone though :(

Well, I won't pretend to commiserate with you on the Giants; not today, at any rate. :)

The Jets are better than they played, though. They should be, at least.

comments.upictitle: Brother Flaming Shuriken of Acceptance: Dangerous Thoughts (Iconomicon)
comments.article: I can sympathize.  I'm a Notre Dame fan.
I was so bummed to see Notre Dame lose yesterday...but that was because it meant Michigan won.

comments.upictitle: When life gives you lemmings...: Ganesha on drums
comments.article: I find it interesting that on the same day the Patriots got their wristslap, the Maclaren team in F1 racing got hit with a hundred-million dollar fine for stealing a copy of Ferrari's playbook.
Maybe they should have videotaped the playbook instead.

I feel your pain.

I predicted at the beginning of this season that it was going to be a long one for the Boys in Blue. I hate being proved right.

I am a Saints fan and want to die.
My heart is a terrible pendulum swinging between embarrassment and flabbergassation.

I am hopeful that we just left our real team at home and once we have a home game we will be able to play again....Monday. Dome.

You can't go 14 - 2 without losing the 2!
(yeah lifelong saints fan. i can dream.)
So, this would be a bad time to mention that, according to my husband, we are Dallas fans?

comments.upictitle: Matthew S. Rotundo: Me with bird
comments.article: Tell me about it.  I'm a Nebraska fan.
Now's a good time to get behind Rutgers football :)

comments.upictitle: trooper221: Speed Will Rule The NFL
comments.article: I was wondering when the "woe is me, for my teams are teh suck" post would come.

comments.upictitle: Darth Paradox: Colette - Zounds (Return To Sender)
comments.article:
Personally, I'm worried about impending apocalypse due to the fact that the Lions are 2-0. First the Tigers, and now this... what the hell is going on in Detroit lately?

(I'm also worried that the Wings are going to have to start sucking to make up for it. Sigh.)

At least you have two teams.

I'm stuck with the f#(king Vikings.
on the bright side, duke won a football game!

It's party time in Durham!

Especially considering it'll be another couple years before we can party again. :)

comments.upictitle: OMG, it's a talking biscuit named Mara!: Nature-Redwood path
comments.article: You could be a Raiders fan :)
comments.subject: Heh, could be worse

comments.article: Raiders took Denver to overtime today.  They will double last year's victories and upset at least one good team (not New England or Indianapolis though)
comments.subject: Re: Heh, could be worse

comments.article: "It's a long season" is a dicho doble per Hemingway. We're only two games in; there are many chances to turn things around. Of course, part of the joys of fandom is ripping on your teams when they lose, but even a hyper-critical fan such as me doesn't give up after two games. Now they both get down 0-3, that's a problem.
comments.subject: long season

comments.article: On the bright side, the Patriots won!
I heard both teams have said they won't win a single game until dance comes out.....
comments.subject: my teams

comments.upictitle: OMG, it's a talking biscuit named Mara!: Nature-Redwood path
comments.article: Dohhhhh! That's low, d00d! lol!
